cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida and 25 miles NW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn WNW then NW across the east‐central Gulf of Mexico, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend, then accelerate NE and move offshore of the GA/SC/NC coasts toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through Georgia, South Carolina and coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty winds possible late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Wilmington, NC based on current track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible late Friday–Saturday, totals generally light to moderate (<4 inches).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and strong rip currents likely along the southeastern North Carolina beaches.
